name: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
summary: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia is an American comedy series about four friends in their late 20s with clear sociopathic tendencies who run an unsuccessful Irish bar, "Paddy's Pub," in South Philadelphia. The series deals with a variety of controversial topics, including abortion, gun control, physical disabilities, racism, sexism, religion, the Israeli/Palestinian situation, terrorism, transsexuality, slavery, incest, sexual harassment in education, the homeless, statutory rape, drug addiction, pedophilia, child abuse, mental illness, gay rights and dumpster babies.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Racist
episodes.summary: The pub becomes an overnight success when the gang accidentally turns it into a gay bar. Elsewhere, Charlie tries to prove to a crush that he's not racist after she catches him making an off-color comment.

episodes.name: Charlie Wants an Abortion
episodes.summary: One of Charlie's old girlfriends claims her 10-year-old son is his. Meanwhile, Mac tries to impress a cute pro-life supporter by feigning interest in her cause; and Dennis attempts to pick up women at an abortion rally.

episodes.name: Underage Drinking: A National Concern
episodes.summary: The gang opens the pub's doors to underage patrons to increase the establishment's profits. Later, Dennis, Charlie and Dee are asked to the prom.

episodes.name: Charlie Has Cancer
episodes.summary: The gang finds out that Charlie may have cancer, so they hatch a plan to relieve his anguish. Meanwhile, Mac gets involved with a transvestite.

episodes.name: Gun Fever
episodes.summary: The guys buy a gun after the bar is robbed, and Charlie uses it to intimidate his nagging landlord. Meanwhile, Dennis and Mac vow to catch the thief, and Dee feigns interest in guns to win over a crush.

episodes.name: The Gang Finds a Dead Guy
episodes.summary: Four twentysomething friends run a struggling Irish pub in Philadelphia. In this episode, Mac and Dennis reach a new low when they pretend to be acquainted with a patron found dead in their bar in order to get closer to his granddaughter. Meanwhile, Dee visits her bedridden grandfather, and Charlie comes along for support.

episodes.name: Charlie Got Molested
episodes.summary: The gang thinks Charlie may have been molested by his high-school gym teacher, so they stage an intervention, and invite Charlie's family and other alleged victims.

episodes.name: Charlie Gets Crippled
episodes.summary: Dennis and Dee's estranged father, Frank Reynolds, returns to town to reconnect with his kids. They don't want anything to do with him, but Frank likes hanging with Charlie and Mac. Meanwhile, Charlie gets hit by Dennis's car (accidentally, of course) and needs to use a wheelchair. The gang soon discovers that this isn't all that bad.

episodes.name: The Gang Goes Jihad
episodes.summary: The gang's new neighbor from Israel threatens to shut down Paddy's, and he has the law on his side. So the gang must "get creative." This means jihad. And Frank's wife, Barbara, returns from vacation, but absence certainly didn't make her heart grow fonder.

episodes.name: Dennis and Dee Go on Welfare
episodes.summary: Driven to distraction by their dad, Dennis and Dee quit Paddy's and decide to go on welfare. Back at the bar, Frank is driving Mac and Charlie crazy. He's also beginning to treat them like sons.

episodes.name: Mac Bangs Dennis' Mom
episodes.summary: Barbara sleeps with Mac to arouse Frank's jealousy, so Dennis decides to seduce Mac's mom as payback. And Frank's decision to put Charlie in charge at the bar prompts an orgy of backstabbing and double-dealing, with sex as the weapon of choice.

episodes.name: Hundred Dollar Baby
episodes.summary: After she's mugged, Dee takes boxing lessons from ex-pug Frank, who runs into an old nemesis at the gym. Meanwhile, Mac and Dennis enter Charlie in an underground street-fight match with hopes of making some money. And both Dee and Charlie need help, which they find in a pill bottle.

episodes.name: The Gang Gives Back
episodes.summary: The gang must perform community service after their "mishap" gets them arrested for arson. While fulfilling his duty, Charlie discovers that he has something in common with the coffee-shop waitress. Meanwhile, Frank's attempt to bond with Dennis backfires.

episodes.name: The Gang Exploits a Miracle
episodes.summary: The Madonna of Paddy's? The gang seeks financial salvation when a leaky pipe at Paddy's causes a water stain on the wall that resembles the Virgin Mary. Meanwhile, Dee has an awkward reunion with a priest who had a crush on her in high school.

episodes.name: The Gang Runs for Office
episodes.summary: Frank offers the gang his political wisdom, which unsurprisingly involves bribery. Then Dennis decides to run for office himself.

episodes.name: Charlie Goes America All Over Everybody's Ass
episodes.summary: Let freedom ring at Paddy's! After an argument about constitutional rights and smoking in the bar, Mac and Dennis decide to lift all behavioral restrictions, and Paddy's soon goes wild. Meanwhile, Charlie and Dee head off to an antitobacco demonstration.

episodes.name: Dennis and Dee Get a New Dad
episodes.summary: Dee receives e-mails from a man who claims to be her father, so she confronts Frank and Barbara to find out what's up. Meanwhile, Mac seeks out his own dad, who's in prison.

episodes.name: The Gang Finds a Dumpster Baby
episodes.summary: Dennis, Dee and Mac find a baby in a Dumpster, and Dee and Mac decide to raise him. They also decide to use him to raise some cash. Meanwhile, Dennis joins an environmental-activist group, and isn't exactly welcomed with open arms. But he finds a way to take revenge. And Charlie wants Frank to take a DNA test to determine whether they're father and son. Frank won't do that, but he's happy to join Charlie on Dumpster-diving expeditions.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Invincible
episodes.summary: Mac, Dennis and Dee try out for the Philadelphia Eagles, but seem more interested in outdoing each other. Also trying out for the team is Doyle McPoyle, a brother of the gang's archenemies, Ryan and Liam McPoyle. The entire McPoyle clan shows up to cheer Doyle on, which is not good news for fellow tailgaters Frank and Charlie.

episodes.name: Dennis and Dee's Mom is Dead
episodes.summary: Dennis and Dee's abrasive mother has died, and the bad news is that she stiffed them in her will, leaving all her money to her humanitarian paramour, Bruce Mathis. But at least Dennis got her house. It's a "party mansion," and that's how he intends to use it.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Held Hostage
episodes.summary: The McPoyles invade Paddy's and take the gang hostage, demanding $100,000, a gassed-up boat and a reversible Planet Hollywood jacket. Meanwhile, Frank is crawling through the ductwork above Paddy's, searching for his will, when Liam McPoyle turns up the heat.

episodes.name: The Aluminum Monster vs. Fatty Magoo
episodes.summary: Dee gets a rude awakening when she discovers that "Fatty Magoo," an overweight loser from her high-school class, is now a svelte, successful clothing-store owner. So Dee decides to design a dress for her, but Dennis decides that he's the better designer. He also knows that he has the charm to sell it to Fatty.

episodes.name: The Gang Solves the North Korea Situation
episodes.summary: The gang declares war on a Korean restaurateur who threatens to bump Paddy's from its coveted and profitable spot on the city's annual pub crawl. Meanwhile, Dee is determined to hold a talent show, primarily because she wants to win it.

episodes.name: The Gang Sells Out
episodes.summary: The gang agrees to sell Paddy's after getting an offer that's too good to turn down. Problem is, Dee and Charlie, who aren't partners, must get real jobs. Members of Frank's "gang," the Yellow Jacket Boys, are played by members of the doo-wop group The Mighty Echoes, who perform.

episodes.name: Frank Sets Sweet Dee on Fire
episodes.summary: The gang want to become local celebrities, so Mac and Charlie create their own newscast on a public-access channel, while Dennis and Dee set out to make a splash on the club scene.

episodes.name: Sweet Dee's Dating a Retarded Person
episodes.summary: Dee dates a famous local rapper and it could turn out to be true love, even though he might be mentally challenged. In any event, his success inspires Mac, Dennis, Charlie and Frank to start their own band.

episodes.name: Mac is a Serial Killer
episodes.summary: Mac has been acting strangely, leading Frank, Dennis and Dee to believe that he's the serial killer who has been terrorizing Philadelphia. So they set out to catch him, but for Dennis and Dee, that means they must first learn to think like serial killers themselves. Frank, meanwhile, is content to let a chainsaw do his thinking for him.

episodes.name: Dennis Looks Like a Registered Sex Offender
episodes.summary: Dennis is mistaken for a recently released child molester; Mac tries to bond with his ex-con father, who can't take his eyes off a creeped-out Dee; and Frank moves out of the apartment he's been sharing with Charlie, and moves in with Charlie's mother.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 1
episodes.summary: A misunderstanding with the mob over a set of speakers and a stash of cocaine prompts Dennis to hire himself out as a male escort. It's that, or he and the rest of the gang will get whacked.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 2
episodes.summary: A now-homeless Father Mara is employed to sell drugs on the street while Dennis embarks on life as a gigolo; and Mac tries to join the mob.

episodes.name: Bums: Making a Mess All Over the City
episodes.summary: To rid their neighborhood of undesirables, Mac and Dee become vigilantes, and Frank and Dennis impersonate police officers. They enjoy the feeling of power this gives them...perhaps too much.

episodes.name: The Gang Dances Their Asses Off
episodes.summary: Season 3 ends as Charlie inadvertently puts Paddy's up as the grand prize in a dance marathon. The gang must then win the competition to keep the bar.

episodes.name: Mac and Dennis: Manhunters
episodes.summary: Dee and Charlie eat some of Frank's stash of extraordinarily tasty meat and won't rest until they can get more. Meanwhile, Mac and Dennis take sport hunting to the next level.

episodes.name: The Gang Solves the Gas Crisis
episodes.summary: Mac, Dennis, and Charlie take advantage of high gas prices by investing in barrels of gasoline and selling them door-to-door; Dee and Frank plot to brand Bruce Mathis as a terrorist leader when they find out that he plans to give their money to a Muslim community center.

episodes.name: America's Next Top Paddy's Billboard Model Contest
episodes.summary: Mac and Frank judge a contest to determine Paddy's next top model; Dee and Charlie strive to come up with YouTube's next sensation.

episodes.name: Mac's Banging the Waitress
episodes.summary: Charlie wants Mac to beat up the waitress's unknown new boyfriend. Trouble is, Mac is the boyfriend.

episodes.name: Mac and Charlie Die
episodes.summary: After Mac's revenge-obsessed father is released from prison, Mac and Charlie fake their deaths to save their lives. Frank, Dee and Dennis find unique ways of dealing with the loss of the guys.

episodes.name: Mac and Charlie Die Part 2
episodes.summary: Frank, Dee and Dennis find unique ways of dealing with the loss of Mac and Charlie. The guys faked their deaths to avoid Mac's vengeance-obsessed father, who was released from prison.

episodes.name: Who Pooped the Bed?
episodes.summary: Frank and Charlie find that someone has soiled their bed, and Mac and Dennis join them as they attempt to catch the culprit. Meanwhile, Dee leads Artemis and the waitress on a "Sex and the City"-style night on the town.

episodes.name: Paddy's Pub: The Worst Bar in Philadelphia
episodes.summary: A newspaper columnist calls Paddy's the worst bar in Philadelphia, and the gang kidnaps him in an effort to force him to change his mind.

episodes.name: Dennis Reynolds: An Erotic Life
episodes.summary: Mac and Frank find Dennis' erotic memoir and attempt to profit from it, while Dee and Charlie spend a day in each other's shoes.

episodes.name: Sweet Dee Has a Heart Attack
episodes.summary: After Dee suffers a heart attack, she and Dennis try to live a healthier lifestyle. Meanwhile, Charlie and Mac take corporate jobs to get health insurance.

episodes.name: The Gang Cracks the Liberty Bell
episodes.summary: The gang fudge history by claiming that Paddy's Pub was responsible for cracking the Liberty Bell in an attempt to turn their dive into a Philadelphia landmark.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Extreme: Home Makeover Edition
episodes.summary: The gang give an extreme home makeover to an ill-fated family, and they hope to receive good karma in return so that their own dreams will come true.

episodes.name: The Nightman Cometh
episodes.summary: Charlie puts on a rock opera based on his song "Nightman," and he gets the rest of the gang to help him.

episodes.name: The Gang Exploits the Mortgage Crisis
episodes.summary: Frank, Mac and Dennis try their hand at real estate; Dee arranges to be a surrogate mother for a rich couple; Charlie squares off with a lawyer over the intricacies of the judicial system.

episodes.name: The Gang Hits the Road
episodes.summary: The gang take a road trip. Destination: the Grand Canyon.

episodes.name: The Great Recession
episodes.summary: With a shantytown taking shape outside, Mac and Dennis try to keep Paddy's going in tough times. Meanwhile, Frank and Dee start a family business.

episodes.name: The Gang Gives Frank an Intervention
episodes.summary: Frank's behavior is more bizarre than usual---so bizarre that even the gang notice---so they decide to stage an intervention.

episodes.name: The Waitress is Getting Married
episodes.summary: The Waitress is getting married, and Dee's jealous because she isn't. Meanwhile, the guys try to get the lovelorn Charlie back into the dating scene.

episodes.name: The World Series Defense
episodes.summary: The gang go to court to talk their way out of a parking ticket they got on the night of the final game of the 2008 World Series.

episodes.name: The Gang Wrestles for the Troops
episodes.summary: The gang stages a wrestling show for returning troops. Meanwhile, Dee meets a soldier she's been talking to online; but he isn't what she expected.

episodes.name: Paddy's Pub: Home of the Original Kitten Mittens
episodes.summary: With a merchandising convention in town, the gang tries to build the Paddy's brand by developing marketable products---such as mittens for kittens.

episodes.name: Mac and Dennis Break Up
episodes.summary: Mac and Dennis decide to take a break from each other, a development that strains relationships. Meanwhile, "kitten mitten" Charlie helps Dee find her lost cat.

episodes.name: The D.E.N.N.I.S. System
episodes.summary: Dennis tells the gang how he seduces women, but none of them can get the hang of it.

episodes.name: Mac and Charlie Write a Movie
episodes.summary: When Dee gets a part in an M. Night Shyamalan film, Mac and Charlie seize a chance to pitch their movie script. But first they have to write it.

episodes.name: The Gang Reignites the Rivalry
episodes.summary: The gang reenters Philadelphia's flip-cup tournament (the Flipadelphia) after being banned for 10 years. Trouble is, their old flip-cup rivals have grown up and moved on.

episodes.name: Mac Fights Gay Marriage
episodes.summary: Mac defends traditional marriage, while the rest of the gang reap the rewards of wedded bliss.

episodes.name: Dennis Gets Divorced
episodes.summary: Dennis' marriage to Maureen Ponderosa hits a snag, as does Charlie's marriage to Frank. And Dee, it seems, has come between Bill Ponderosa and his wife

episodes.name: The Gang Buys a Boat
episodes.summary: Mac, Charlie and Dennis buy a boat to "throw some P. Diddy-style parties," as Mac puts it, and, Charlie insists, to harvest shrimp (or barnacles). They end up with a run-down houseboat, the Drowning Sailor, and Mac and Dennis order Dee (who didn't invest in it) to clean it up. Frank, sledgehammer in hand, offers to help.

episodes.name: Mac's Big Break
episodes.summary: Mac finally gets his big break after correctly answering a radio station's trivia question. Meanwhile, Frank, Dennis and Dee start their own bar-banter podcast.

episodes.name: Mac and Charlie: White Trash
episodes.summary: There's a heat wave in Philly, so Mac and Charlie decide to fix up an abandoned pool after they're denied admittance to a swim club. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee try to beat the heat in a more "dignified" manner.

episodes.name: Mac's Mom Burns Her House Down
episodes.summary: After Mac's mother burns her house down with a cigarette, Mac decides that she should move in with Charlie's mom. Meanwhile, Frank offers to take care of the ailing Dee because he wants her to take care of him when he's old.

episodes.name: Who Got Dee Pregnant?
episodes.summary: Dee's pregnant, and she tells the guys that one of them made her that way during a Halloween party that none of them can remember. So they try to piece the evening together, "Potemkin"-style, aided by Artemis and the McPoyle brothers.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets a New Member
episodes.summary: The gang is growing as a result of a blast from the past, which also prompts Dee to reconsider her future.

episodes.name: Dee Reynolds: Shaping America's Youth
episodes.summary: Dee takes a job as a substitute teacher and decides to take her students on a field trip to Broadway. The principal won't allow that, so it's a screening of the gang's movie---"Lethal Weapon 5"---instead.

episodes.name: Charlie Kelly: King of the Rats
episodes.summary: Charlie is going batty trying to keep rats out of Paddy's basement, so the gang decides to throw him a surprise party to cheer him up.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Stranded in the Woods
episodes.summary: When the gang goes to Atlantic City for a charity benefit, Frank, Dee and Mac get lost en route. But Dennis and Charlie hitch a ride to town and have the time of their lives.

episodes.name: Dee Gives Birth
episodes.summary: Dee's blessed event is fast approaching, but the father's identity remains a mystery---to the gang, at least. So they throw a party and invite all of Dee's former flings.

episodes.name: A Very Sunny Christmas
episodes.summary: The gang sets out to discover the joy of Christmas. Their holiday adventure includes a sleighful of stolen toys, childhood videos, naked elves and a bloody encounter with Santa Claus.

episodes.name: Frank's Pretty Woman
episodes.summary: Frank wants to marry a prostitute and the gang can't talk him out of it. While Dee sets out to burnish the hooker's heart of gold, Charlie takes a different tack: He tries to set Frank up with another woman. Meanwhile, Mac has put on a lot of weight. "I'm cultivating mass," he tells Dennis.

episodes.name: The Gang Goes to the Jersey Shore
episodes.summary: Dee and Dennis take the gang to their favorite childhood vacation spot on the Jersey Shore. Things aren't quite as they remember them. Still, Mac, Frank and Charlie have the times of their lives; Dee and Dennis not so much.

episodes.name: Frank Reynolds' Little Beauties
episodes.summary: Frank finds himself in the child beauty-pageant business and fears that people might think that he's in it for the wrong reasons. Meanwhile, Dee wages war on stage moms; and Mac, Dennis and Charlie think they have found a contestant to back.

episodes.name: Sweet Dee Gets Audited
episodes.summary: While Dee tries to weasel her way out of an IRS audit, the guys set up a new (and, they say, democratic) way of running Paddy's.

episodes.name: Frank's Brother
episodes.summary: Frank's long-lost brother shows up unexpectedly and spills family secrets.

episodes.name: The Storm of the Century
episodes.summary: It's not always sunny in Philadelphia: An apocalyptic storm is bearing down on the City of Brotherly Love, and everyone's in panic mode—except for Frank.

episodes.name: Chardee MacDennis: The Game of Games
episodes.summary: Another rainy day in Philadelphia. The gang can't go out and play, so they stay indoors and play a board game of their own devising. (It doesn't much resemble Chutes and Ladders). They also drink.

episodes.name: The ANTI-Social Network
episodes.summary: While Dennis and Charlie track down an annoying Paddy's patron the old-fashioned way, Dee and Mac cyberstalk him. Frank is online as well, trying to boost business at the bar. Things go viral, and not in a good way for Frank.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Trapped
episodes.summary: The gang sneak into a residence to "extract" an "artifact," only to discover that someone is home. Uh-oh.

episodes.name: How Mac Got Fat
episodes.summary: Mac claims that his gang mates made him fat. (Or so he says to a priest who's hearing his confession.)

episodes.name: Thunder Gun Express
episodes.summary: A presidential visit to Philadelphia causes traffic jams, frustrating the gang's effort to see the summer's hottest action movie, "Thunder Gun Express." So the gang takes action— "Thunder Gun"-style action—to get to the theater.

episodes.name: The High School Reunion
episodes.summary: The gang have much to prove when they attend their high-school reunion. They meet old friends and make new foes as they stroll—make that trip—down memory lane.

episodes.name: The High School Reunion Part 2: The Gang's Revenge
episodes.summary: In the Season 7 finale, the gang come up with a new plan to buff their tarnished high-school reputations at their high-school reunion.

episodes.name: Pop-Pop: The Final Solution
episodes.summary: Dennis and Dee's ailing grandfather Pop-Pop is wasting away in the hospital, and they have to decide whether or not to pull the plug. But things get complicated when The Gang learns of Pop-Pop's history as a Nazi, and Mac, Charlie and Frank set off in search of the old man's spoils from the war.

episodes.name: The Gang Recycles Their Trash
episodes.summary: With the garbage men of Philadelphia on strike, Frank concocts a plan to undercut the union and get the contract to collect the city's trash. But when The Gang's elaborate plan starts to fall apart, everyone will get their hands a little dirtier than expected.

episodes.name: The Maureen Ponderosa Wedding Massacre
episodes.summary: Dennis and the gang crash Maureen's wedding to make certain he'll be able to sever all ties, only to discover a union much scarier than kissing cousins.

episodes.name: Charlie and Dee Find Love
episodes.summary: When Charlie and Dee invade the rarefied world of the 1%, they find a romantic connection with two members of one of Philly's wealthiest families. When they catch wind of the fancy dinners, tennis matches and big parties, Mac, Dennis and Frank try to get a piece of the action. But, when all the scheming comes to a head, the whole gang learns a lesson in love.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Analyzed
episodes.summary: The Gang gets Freudian as they step into the therapist's office to work through their mountain of issues. But when Dennis thinks he has everyone figured out, the shrink turns the tables on him and exposes the insanity in his unique brand of pop psychology. Dennis' psychology is exposed as abnormal indeed.

episodes.name: Charlie's Mom Has Cancer
episodes.summary: In perhaps the most depraved scheme of them all, The Gang rallies around Charlie's mom as she battles cancer. As Mac, Charlie, and Dee struggle with their faith, Frank loses his memory and his mind in a quest for buried treasure, and they're all rocked by a revelation that will shake Paddy's to its very foundation!

episodes.name: Frank's Back in Business
episodes.summary: With Charlie under his wing, Frank cleans up so he can get his hands dirty and help out his old company with one last big merger. While an unwritten rule of the bar gets the rest of the gang caught up in a case of mistaken identity.

episodes.name: Charlie Rules the World
episodes.summary: After slipping into an unhealthy obsession with computer games, The Gang wrestles to define the difference between the real and the virtual worlds.

episodes.name: The Gang Dines Out
episodes.summary: Every member of The Gang has something to celebrate at Guigino's, Philly's finest eatery. But when Mac and Dennis' private dinner is interrupted by an unexpected sighting of Frank and Charlie, the in-fighting begins. Dee turns up at a table for one, and over the course of the night, the "one-ups-manship" soars to new heights.

episodes.name: Reynolds vs. Reynolds: The Cereal Defense
episodes.summary: Court is in session at Paddy's Pub as Frank and Dennis present their cases to the rest of the gang, resulting in a verdict that will change their lives FOREVER...but not really.

episodes.name: The Gang Broke Dee
episodes.summary: Dee starts to embrace the desperate, self-loathing qualities the guys have beaten into her over the years, sending her stand-up comedy career to unexpected places.

episodes.name: Gun Fever Too: Still Hot
episodes.summary: After Frank appears on Local Television advocating gun ownership, the rest of the gang takes a look at the ownership process and alternatives to find a common ground on this still heated issue.

episodes.name: The Gang Tries Desperately to Win an Award
episodes.summary: Tired of failing to be recognized for their years of service in the bar industry, the gang changes their ways to give the patrons what they think they want.

episodes.name: Mac and Dennis Buy a Timeshare
episodes.summary: The gang does their best to recoup their investments in questionable schemes by dumping their losses on Ben the soldier while trying to avoid being duped again by whatever mastermind is pulling their strings.

episodes.name: Mac Day
episodes.summary: Everyone in the gang gets a day to do what they want while everyone else in the gang must participate willingly. This is Mac's Day...and its got twice the "Mac".

episodes.name: The Gang Saves the Day
episodes.summary: When a routine trip to a convenience store places the gang in the middle of an armed robbery, each of them is forced to explore how they react in extreme situations.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Quarantined
episodes.summary: When a severe flu outbreak sweeps Philadelphia the gang voluntarily quarantine themselves inside of Paddy's in an attempt to keep their singing voices pristine for an upcoming competition, although they have trouble adhering to the strict rules they've set for themselves.

episodes.name: Flowers for Charlie
episodes.summary: When an experiment successfully multiplies Charlie's intellect and takes him away from the bar, the rest of the gang find themselves struggling to complete the menial 'Charlie Work' that has kept the bar running for so long.

episodes.name: The Gang Makes Lethal Weapon 6
episodes.summary: After creative differences over what constitutes tasteful nudity cause Frank to pull his money out of Lethal Weapon 6 during filming, Mac, Dennis, and Charlie screen their rough footage for investors in hopes of raising enough capital to finish the production of their latest masterpiece.

episodes.name: The Gang Squashes Their Beefs
episodes.summary: When some bad blood with old foes compromises their ideal Thanksgiving, the gang decides to make amends by breaking bread with those they've hurt.

episodes.name: The Gang Beats Boggs
episodes.summary: "The Gang Beats Boggs" - Mac oversees the gang while they compete to break Wade Boggs' legendary beer drinking record.

episodes.name: The Gang Group Dates
episodes.summary: The gang gets into the online dating scene to expand their matchmaking potential.

episodes.name: Psycho Pete Returns
episodes.summary: When Psycho Pete, long lost member of the freight train, is released from the mental hospital, Dennis and Dee rush to get him recommitted while Charlie and Mac attempt to restore him to his former hard-partying form.

episodes.name: Charlie Work
episodes.summary: When a surprise health inspection falls on the same day as one of the gang's less hygienic schemes, Charlie tries to keep the gang working together to make sure Paddy's makes the grade.

episodes.name: The Gang Spies Like U.S.
episodes.summary: After Dennis and Mac enlist Dee to spy on the fish factory across the street, Charlie and Frank grow suspicious and decide to do some spying of their own.

episodes.name: The Gang Misses the Boat
episodes.summary: After another failed venture, the Gang wonders if their group dynamic is bringing them down as individuals, causing them to separate from one another, and find out who they really are.

episodes.name: Mac Kills His Dad
episodes.summary: News surfaces about Mac's Dad, Luther, being a murder suspect. Mac goes into full "P.I." mode to clear his father of any wrong doing.

episodes.name: The Gang Goes on Family Fight
episodes.summary: When the gang appears on a nationally broadcasted game show, Dennis does his best to keep the gang's weirdness under wraps.

episodes.name: Frank Retires
episodes.summary: After Frank decides he's worked long enough, the rest of the gang strategizes amongst and against each other for control over "Paddy's".

episodes.name: Ass Kickers United: Mac and Charlie Join a Cult
episodes.summary: "Asskickers" isn't just a hot new way to work out; it's a way of life...and maybe a cult.

episodes.name: Chardee MacDennis 2: Electric Boogaloo
episodes.summary: The gang agrees to a truce while demonstrating Chardee MacDennis for an interested board game executive, but the nature of the game quickly sends things off the rails.

episodes.name: Frank Falls Out the Window
episodes.summary: Frank falls out the window causing him to think it's 2006, the gang approaches it as a do-over and attempts to fix their past mistakes.

episodes.name: The Gang Hits the Slopes
episodes.summary: Dennis and Frank square off against Dee and Mac for control of the mountain, while Charlie learns that the slopes have their own set of rules.

episodes.name: Dee Made a Smut Film
episodes.summary: Dennis and Dee film an adaptation of Dennis' erotic memoirs while Frank and Mac try to pass off Charlie as a gifted artist for financial gain.

episodes.name: Mac & Dennis Move to the Suburbs
episodes.summary: Mac and Dennis move to the suburbs for the cheap rent and open spaces but learn they may be meant for city life.

episodes.name: Being Frank
episodes.summary: A day in the life of Frank Reynold's as he tries to keep up with the gang's newest scheme.

episodes.name: McPoyle vs. Ponderosa: The Trial of the Century
episodes.summary: Old grievances bubble to the surface when The Lawyer agrees to sue Bill Ponderosa on behalf of the Liam McPoyle and his lost eye.

episodes.name: Charlie Catches a Leprechaun
episodes.summary: Dennis tries to create an innovative mobile Paddy's pub experience but runs into trouble when customers refuse to cooperate, while Charlie and Mac attempt to catch a thieving leprechaun.

episodes.name: The Gang Goes to Hell: Part 1
episodes.summary: The gang tries to take a vacation from their usual dynamic by going on a cruise, but old habits die hard.

episodes.name: The Gang Goes to Hell: Part 2
episodes.summary: The gang gets real with one another in the face of death.

episodes.name: The Gang Turns Black
episodes.summary: After an electric heating blanket shorts out while the gang watches the Wiz they look in the mirror and realize they've turned black. They have to figure out how to get back to being themselves by going through all the classic body switch movie shenanigans they encounter.

episodes.name: The Gang Goes to a Water Park
episodes.summary: The gang takes a trip to a local waterpark, ripe with personal agendas and ulterior motives. Dennis feeds off his mantra of "the park provides" and takes on a protégé. Frank and Charlie are determined to ride every ride by any means necessary and Mac and Dee get stuck in a tube slide for most of the day.

episodes.name: Old Lady House: A Situation Comedy
episodes.summary: Charlie thinks Mac's mom is holding his mom hostage so the gang installs spy cameras in their house to monitor what's going on. What they end up discovering is the moms are quite entertaining once Dennis makes some quick edits and adds a laugh track to the surveillance footage. Dee wants in on the new hit show and Frank becomes obsessed with banging Charlie's mom now that he's seen her on TV.

episodes.name: Wolf Cola: A Public Relations Nightmare
episodes.summary: Franks Fluids LLC is in big trouble after a news segment shows Wolf Cola has become the official drink of Boko Haram. Dee and Dennis help with the PR nightmare while Charlie and Mac work on a scheme to make Fight Milk the official drink of the UFC.

episodes.name: Making Dennis Reynolds a Murderer
episodes.summary: An episode filmed in the true crime style of Making a Murderer and The Jinx which begins with 911 call: A cat-woman formerly known as Maureen Ponderosa has been found dead in an alley and Dennis is the prime suspect.

episodes.name: Hero or Hate Crime?
episodes.summary: The gang goes to a professional arbitrator to decide who's the rightful owner of a scratch off lottery ticket. While they're there they also try to clear up whether or not the events surrounding the scratcher prove that Frank is a hero or hate monger.

episodes.name: PTSDee
episodes.summary: After finding out she's a male stripper's "rock bottom," Dee goes on a mission to prove she's the best thing that ever happened to him. Dennis takes over for the stripper with the help of his bag boy, Charlie. Meanwhile, Mac and Frank get sucked into a VR war game that causes Mac to develop his own case of PTSD.

episodes.name: The Gang Tends Bar
episodes.summary: It's Valentine's Day and Paddy's is packed with customers. Dennis implores the gang to do one day of actual work but everyone else is distracted by a mystery crate Cricket spotted in the alley. Eventually, the gang becomes convinced Dennis really wants them to work on their relationships and everyone shares their grievances without much resolution.

episodes.name: A Cricket's Tale
episodes.summary: We get to see a typical day in Cricket's world and then a possible redemption when his family intervenes. Will Cricket finally move on from the gang, finding love in the process? Will Cricket go from filthy beast to his former self, Matthew Mara?

episodes.name: Dennis' Double Life
episodes.summary: Dennis reveals he has a baby from his Wade Boggs layover in North Dakota. Everyone offers a solution for how to get him out of this jam. Mac suggests they pretend to be a couple and Frank wants to make the broad a "decent" proposal b/c $1 million for sex is indecent. In the end, Dennis has to decide which life he wants to continue to lead.

episodes.name: The Gang Makes Paddy's Great Again
episodes.summary: Meet Cindy, the new, ethnically diverse female member of the gang who can successfully pull off scams. Everything is working until Mac introduces a new member: a life-like sex doll that looks exactly like Dennis. Directed by Todd Biermann.

episodes.name: The Gang Escapes
episodes.summary: To boost productivity, Dee hires an at-home "Escape Room Experience" service to come to Dennis and Mac's apartment. Will they escape? Who will get the credit? What could go wrong?

episodes.name: The Gang Beats Boggs: Ladies Reboot
episodes.summary: To one-up the guys, Dee has organized an "all-female reboot" of the Wade Boggs challenge on a first-of-its-kind, all-female flight headed to L.A. for the women's march.

episodes.name: Time's Up for the Gang
episodes.summary: Paddy's has been put on a list of bars that are sexually hostile to women, and the gang must attend a sexual harassment seminar to get off the list.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets New Wheels
episodes.summary: Dee gets in with a group of cool, rich housewives. Dennis hits it off with some everyday blue-collar bros. Frank struggles to renew his license, and Charlie and Mac deal with a new generation of bicycle bullies.

episodes.name: The Gang Solves the Bathroom Problem
episodes.summary: Jimmy Buffett is in town and the positive vibes are alive at the bar. But when Mac comes out of the women's bathroom, no one can leave until the bathroom situation is solved.

episodes.name: The Gang Does a Clip Show
episodes.summary: With nothing to do while their phones update to the latest software, the gang decides to reminisce on old times. As everyone misremembers events from their past, the gang's current reality becomes altered.

episodes.name: Charlie's Home Alone
episodes.summary: It's the weekend of Super Bowl LII, this time from Charlie's perspective. While Charlie searches the back office, Cricket steals the suit leaving Charlie home alone to defend himself.

episodes.name: The Gang Wins the Big Game
episodes.summary: It's the most important weekend of their lives and Frank has treated the gang and a crew of their ragtag hangers-on with tickets to see the Eagles in the Super Bowl!

episodes.name: Mac Finds His Pride
episodes.summary: Frank tries to recruit Mac for the gang's float for the Gay Pride Parade; Frank comes to the realization that Mac will never be secure with his sexual identity unless he comes out to his father.

episodes.name: The Gang Gets Romantic
episodes.summary: Mac concocts a scheme to attract single women to Airbnb Dennis' bedroom, while Frank and Charlie concoct similar plans to attract young, European coeds. But neither ad attracts their intended target.

episodes.name: Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool
episodes.summary: The Gang finds themselves in the middle of a focus group after a screening of Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool. They are determined to restore glory and traditional American values back into the franchise, even if it involves sabotage.

episodes.name: Dee Day
episodes.summary: The Guys are in the final preparation stage for an unknown scheme when Dee excitedly enters to inform them that today is "Dee Day." The guys have to do everything she wants without complaint.

episodes.name: The Gang Chokes
episodes.summary: Annoyed that the Gang failed to react as he nearly choked to death on an appetizer, Frank decides the Waiter, his savior, is the only person who has his back.

episodes.name: The Gang Texts
episodes.summary: During their trip to the Philadelphia Zoo, Mac sets up a text group chain for The Gang, but confusion sets in and The Gang must learn from the meerkats on how to communicate properly in a group.

episodes.name: The Janitor Always Mops Twice
episodes.summary: In the black-and-white noir world of his memory, Charlie navigates the seedy underbelly of Philadelphia as Frank has been "diarrhea poisoned," and it's up to Charlie to clean up the mess.

episodes.name: The Gang Solves Global Warming
episodes.summary: As a record-breaking heat wave overtakes Philly, the Gang plans to profit from global warming by pumping up the A/C so people will congregate at Paddy's and save energy at home.

episodes.name: Paddy's Has a Jumper
episodes.summary: Trapped inside Paddy's with a suicide jumper on the roof, the Gang wonders if they should bother intervening with an algorithm of their own - Could he, would he, should we? the second half hour, Dennis and Charlie stand guard at the entrance to their laser tag base waiting to ambush the legendary "Big Mo," but Dennis begins to ponder the reasons they play laser tag and if their pursuit of a victory is worth their effort.

episodes.name: A Woman's Right to Chop
episodes.summary: When a trendy new hair salon opens up right next door to Paddy's, Dennis and Frank go on the offensive to stop women from cutting off their hair. Meanwhile, Mac is reunited with his childhood dog Poppins..

episodes.name: Waiting for Big Mo
episodes.summary: Dennis and Charlie stand guard at the entrance to their laser tag base waiting to ambush the legendary "Big Mo," but Dennis begins to ponder the reasons they play laser tag and if their pursuit of a victory is worth their effort.
